fluff.name: Soul Binder
entries: Ensamhet. Svaghet. Kallelse till äventyr. För de flesta människor är detta övergående ögonblick, en del av vardagens upp- och nedgångar. Det finns dock de som definieras av dessa känslor. Vare sig de känner sig ensamma i en folkmassa, maktlösa för att få vad de förtjänar eller ivriga att se allt som världen har att erbjuda, har själsbindare tagit ett drastiskt steg för att lösa sina problem. Eftersom de inte kan möta världens krav på egen hand väljer de att ge upp en bit av sin själ för att knyta band med en annan varelse och möta livets utmaningar tillsammans.

entries.name: A Companion for Life
entries: När själsbindare binder sig till en annan varelse gör de det för livet. De kommer alltid att stå tillsammans, två mot två mot världen. De kommer alltid att ta hand om varandra, för i slutändan behöver de varandra. Vare sig de vill det eller inte.
Kompanjonen är ofta den starkare i paret, men utan binderen som vägleder den är kompanjonen inte ens i närheten av sin fulla potential.

entries.name: Creating a Soul Binder
entries: När du gör din själsbindare måste du tänka på hur du fick din följeslagare. Reste du runt i världen för att söka en följeslagare, var det lätt för dig, eller var det ett livsmål, var det ens ditt val att binda din själ? Kanske blev du tillfångatagen av kultister som tvingade dig att binda dig med en varelse mot din och varelsens vilja.

Vilken typ av relation har du till din följeslagare? Är ni två oskiljaktiga vänner? Eller är det mer ett förhållande mellan herre och tjänare? Ibland kan en själsbindare ångra sin själsbindning och vilja göra den ogjord, även om det är en svår och långvarig process.
Soul Binders är i kontakt med sin följeslagare som ingen annan varelse någonsin kommer att vara, och när du spelar som en SoulBinder kan du beskriva hur du och din följeslagare agerar.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Du kan göra en själslig pärm snabbt genom att följa dessa förslag. För det första bör Charisma vara din högsta förmågemodifierare, följt av Konstitution eller Dexterity, beroende på om du behöver ta skada eller ge den. För det andra bör du ta {@background hermit} bakgrund.

tools: your choice of one artisan's tools, or musical instrument

default: (a) Two {@item dagger|phb|daggers} (b) any {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (c) any {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} (if proficient)
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item scholar's pack|phb}
(a) a set of {@item Leather armor|phb} or (b) a set of {@item Scale mail|phb} (if proficient)
(a) a set of {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

classFeature.name: Soul Bond
entries: De varelser som låter sig bindas till en själsbindare är mäktiga varelser från olika riken i universum. Kanske har du bundit din själ till en godhjärtad himmelsvarelse från de övre planen för att få skydd, kanske har du gjort ett snedvridet avtal med en djävul för deras tjänster, som du kommer att behöva uppfylla en dag, eller kanske har du skapat varelsen själv av metall eller kött och använt din själ för att ge den liv. Hur som helst är ni bundna till varandra av ett obrytbart löfte tills en av er går under.

Olika själsbindare knyter band till olika typer av varelser. Varje varelse ger själsbindaren olika förmågor både i och utanför strid och påverkar dem på olika sätt, till exempel genom att ge dem magiska krafter eller göra dem till en kraftfull kraft på slagfältet.

På 1:a nivån har du valt att offra en del av din egen själ för att få hjälp av en varelse som är starkare än du. Ditt val av band ger dig ytterligare egenskaper när du når 3:e nivån och igen på 7:e, 11:e och 15:e nivån.

classFeature.name: Bonded Companion
entries: På 1:a nivån får du en följeslagare som hjälper dig på alla sätt den kan. Kompanjonen får bonusar av att vara kopplad till din essens. I strid rör sig följeslagaren och agerar på din tur i initiativ. Du kan beordra den verbalt (ingen handling behövs) och om du är {@condition incapacitated} kommer den att göra sitt bästa för att skydda dig och sig själv från skada.

Du och din följeslagare får båda makt genom det band ni delar, men det är bara en av er som kan dra full nytta av den kraften till en början. Om du tar handlingen {@action Attack} eller {@action Cast a Spell} med en kasttid på en handling kan din följeslagare inte ta handlingen {@action Attack} i samma tur, och om din följeslagare tar handlingen {@action Attack} kan du inte ta handlingen {@action Attack} eller {@action Cast a Spell} med en kasttid på en handling i samma tur.
Mer information om din följeslagare finns i funktionen Själsbundna egenskaper.

classFeature.name: Soulbound Traits
entries: Din själsbundna följeslagare har sina egna träffar tärningar och kan använda dem under en kort vila. På första nivån är dess träffpoäng lika med det maximala värdet av dess träfftärningar + dess konstitutionsmodifierare. När du får en nivå i den här klassen ökar din följeslagare också sin nivå, och den kan öka sitt maximum av träffpunkter med hjälp av sina träfftärningar som vanligt.

När du får klassegenskapen Ability Score Improvement i den här klassen förbättras också din följeslagares förmågor. Du kan öka en av dess förmågaspoäng enligt ditt val med 2, eller du kan öka två av dess förmågaspoäng enligt ditt val med 1. Enligt DM:s gottfinnande kan du avstå från att öka följeslagarens förmågaspoäng och istället ta en feat enligt ditt val för den. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågaspoäng över 20 med hjälp av den här egenskapen om inte beskrivningen av den anger något annat.

Din följeslagare hjälper dig både i och utanför strid, eftersom den får bonusar för att den är kopplad till ditt väsen. Den får färdigheter i två färdigheter som du själv väljer. På områden där den skulle använda sin färdighetsbonus använder den din färdighetsbonus istället. Den använder också din färdighetsbonus när den beräknar sin AC.

Din följeslagare använder alltid Styrka för sina anfalls- och skadekast (om inget annat anges), och dess skadetärning visas i följeslagarens statblock. Om en egenskap för din följeslagare kräver att en annan varelse gör ett räddningskast, är DC lika med ditt Spell Save DC.

Om din följeslagare har 0 träffpoäng faller den {@condition unconscious} och måste göra räddningskast för att rädda sin död. När den reduceras till 0 träffpunkter tar själsbindaren all överskottsskada från attacken. Om den dödas kan du återföra den till liv som en del av en lång vila. Processen att återuppliva kan vara mycket hård för din själ, och du får en nivå av utmattning i slutet av vilan när du återupplivar din följeslagare.
Om du dör får din följeslagare en nivå av utmattning för varje minut du är död tills du återupplivas igen eller följeslagaren också dör.

classFeature.name: Hidden Form
entries: Du har lärt dig hur du kan minska din följeslagares storlek eller gömma den på ett annat plan för att enkelt kunna gömma eller bära den. På 1:a nivån lär du dig en av följande egenskaper:

items.name: Shrink.
items.entry: Du kan använda din bonusåtgärd för att ändra din följeslagares storlek till Tiny eller tillbaka till sin fulla storlek om den befinner sig inom 30 fot från dig. Om det inte finns tillräckligt med utrymme för att den ska kunna växa till sin ursprungliga storlek tar den istället {@dice 1d10} kraftskada och förblir Tiny. När följeslagaren är i Tiny-form kan den inte attackera på något sätt.

items.name: Pocket Dimension.
items.entry: Som en handling kan du tillfälligt avfärda din följeslagare så länge den befinner sig inom en radie av 1,5 meter från dig. Den försvinner in i en fickdimension där den väntar på din kallelse. Som en handling kan du, medan den är avvisad, få den att åter dyka upp i ett obebott utrymme inom 5 fot från dig. Om du faller {@condition unconscious} medan din följeslagare är i sin fickdimension, dyker den upp igen inom 5 fot på dig.

items.name: Disguise.
items.entry: Som en åtgärd kan du skapa en illusion runt din följeslagare som får den att se ut som ett annat djur eller en humanoid av liknande storlek och kroppsbyggnad, till exempel kan du få en drake att se ut som en hund eller en demon att se ut som en bonde. Förklädnaden slutar om din följeslagare tar skada, ger skada till en annan varelse eller om du avslutar den som en handling.

entries: I slutet av en lång vila kan du välja att byta ut din Hidden Form-funktion mot en annan.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: På andra nivån är du mer van vid att vara knuten till en magisk varelse och har börjat kunna använda magi för att hjälpa dina allierade eller stärka din följeslagare. Se {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} i spelarhandboken för de allmänna reglerna för trollkonst.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: På andra nivån kan du två valfria trollkonster från {@filter soul binder spell list|spells|level=0|class=Soul Binder (SBFS)}. Du lär dig ytterligare en själsbindare cantrip av ditt val på 4:e nivån och ytterligare en på 10:e nivån.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: Tabellen Soul Binder visar hur många spell slots du har för att kasta dina soul binder-besvärjelser. För att kasta en av dina själsbindarbesvärjelser på 1:a nivån eller högre, måste du använda en spelled på samma nivå eller högre. Du återfår alla förbrukade trollformelplatser när du avslutar en lång vila.

Du förbereder en lista över de trollformler för själsbindare som är tillgängliga för dig att kasta, och väljer från {@filter soul binder spell list|spells|class=Soul Binder (SBFS)}. När du gör det väljer du ett antal själsbindarbesvärjelser som är lika med din Charismamodifierare + halva din själsbindarnivå (minst en besvärjelse). Besvärjelserna måste vara av en nivå som du har spell slots för.

Om du till exempel är en själsbindare på 5:e nivån har du fyra spell slots på 1:a nivån och två på 2:a nivån. Med en Charisma på 14 kan din lista över förberedda trollformler innehålla fyra trollformler på 1:a eller 2:a nivån, i vilken kombination som helst. Om du förbereder förtrollningen heroism på 1:a nivån kan du kasta den med hjälp av en plats på 1:a eller 2:a nivån. Att kasta besvärjelsen tar inte bort den från din lista över förberedda besvärjelser.

Du kan ändra din lista över förberedda trollformler när du avslutar en lång vila. Att förbereda en ny lista över själsbindarbesvärjelser kräver tid som du spenderar i meditation med din följeslagare: minst 1 minut per besvärjelsenivå för varje besvärjelse på din lista.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma är din trollförmåga för dina själsbindarbesvärjelser, eftersom kraften i din magi är beroende av att du kan kommunicera med din följeslagare och det band som ni delar. Du använder din Charisma närhelst en trollformel hänvisar till din förtrollningsförmåga. Dessutom använder du din Charisma-modifierare när du fastställer räddningskast-DC:n för en själsbindarbesvärjelse som du kastar och när du gör en attackrulle med en sådan.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: Du kan använda ett arkans fokus (som du hittar i {@book chapter 5|PHB|5} i Player's Handbook) som ett trollformelsfokus för dina själsbindande trollformler.

classFeature.name: Edict
entries: Du har fått bättre kontroll över din följeslagare och kan ge den mer komplicerade kommandon. Du kan använda en bonusåtgärd för att tala ett kommando till din följeslagare. Den måste kunna höra dig för att kommandot ska få effekt.
På andra nivån lär du dig följande kommandon:

items.name: Strike.
items.entry: Du beordrar din följeslagare att attackera med extra kraft. Nästa gång din följeslagare träffar en annan varelse med en attack den här vändan, ger den attacken extra {@dice 2d6} skada.

items.name: Toughen Up.
items.entry: Du beordrar din följeslagare att skärpa sig och vara redo att stå emot ännu fler slag. Din följeslagare får {@dice 2d6} tillfälliga träffpunkter som varar i 10 minuter.

items.name: Block.
items.entry: Du beordrar din följeslagare att undvika eller blockera inkommande attacker i stället för att ta emot dem. Fram till slutet av din nästa tur kan din följeslagare lägga till din Charismamodifierare till alla räddningskast den måste göra, och lägga till halva din Charimsa-modifierare (avrundat uppåt) till sin AC.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: Du talar om för din följeslagare att den måste röra sig snabbt eller säkert. När din följeslagare får detta kommando kan han/hon ta {@action Disengage} eller {@action Dash} som en bonusåtgärd under den här vändan.

entries: Du kan använda den här egenskapen ett antal gånger som är lika med din Charisma-modifierare (minst 1), och du kan återfå alla användningar när du vilar.
Antalet tärningar för ediktet "Strike" och "Toughen Up" ökar när du får fler nivåer i den här klassen och ökar till {@dice 3d6} på 5:e nivån, {@dice 4d6} på 11:e nivån och {@dice 5d6} på 17:e nivån.

classFeature.name: Soul Bond Feature
entries: På 3:e nivån får du en egenskap från ditt Soul Bond.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Absorption
entries: När du når 3:e nivån kan själsbindaren utföra en speciell ritual för att slå ihop ett magiskt föremål med sin följeslagare under en kort vila. Att smälta samman med ett föremål kräver fysisk kontakt mellan själsbindaren, föremålet och följeslagaren.

Vissa föremål har förutsättningar. För att föremålet ska kunna slås samman med en följeslagare måste följeslagaren uppfylla alla förutsättningar för att det ska kunna slås samman med föremålet. Din följeslagare kan inte slå sig samman med föremål som kräver en klassförutsättning. Om den korta vilan avbryts misslyckas sammanslagningen. I annat fall, i slutet av den korta vilan, smälter föremålet samman med följeslagaren.

Medan han/hon är sammanfogad får följeslagaren en intuitiv förståelse för hur han/hon aktiverar föremålets magiska egenskaper, inklusive alla nödvändiga kommandoradord. Din följeslagare kan använda föremålets magiska egenskaper och tillämpa effekterna på sina naturliga vapen och naturliga rustningar, men får inte fördelarna med själva rustningen eller vapnet. Den kan bara ha ett vapen sammansmält åt gången och ett rustningsstycke. Kamratens naturliga vapen kan bara dra nytta av ett av de sammanslagna föremålen, och du kan ändra detta på en kort vila, detsamma gäller för dess naturliga rustning. Om den absorberar ett vapen blir dess attacker magiska.

Exempel: Om du binder en +1 {@item Plate armor|phb} till din följeslagare får den +1 till sin AC, men inte fördelarna med att bära {@item Plate armor|phb}. Varje sammanfogat föremål inom varelsen räknas som en intoning för själsbindaren, oavsett om föremålet krävde intoning eller inte. Försök att sammansmälta med mer än tre föremål misslyckas automatiskt. Själsbindaren kan frivilligt avsluta sammansmältningen genom att spendera ytterligare en kort vila fokuserad på föremålet, såvida inte föremålet är förbannat.
Om följeslagaren dör, slungas alla sammansmältningsföremål ut från liket på marken runt omkring.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: När du når 4:e nivån kan du öka en valfri förmågepoäng med 2 eller två valfria förmågepoäng med 1. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågepoäng över 20 med den här funktionen.
Om din DM tillåter användning av feats kan du istället ta en {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Advanced Offense
entries: Från och med nivå 5 har du och din följeslagare förbättrat era färdigheter i strid och arbetar ännu bättre tillsammans.
Du får en av följande egenskaper som du själv väljer:

entries.name: Companion Extra Attack.
entries: Din följeslagare kan attackera två gånger istället för en gång när den gör {@action Attack} i sin tur.

entries.name: Expert Commanding.
entries: Det finns inte längre några begränsningar för när du eller din följeslagare kan utföra en {@action Attack} handling eller {@action Cast a Spell} med en kasttid på 1 handling så länge det är en själsbindarbesvärjelse.
På 11:e nivån får du den andra funktionen som du inte valde på 5:e nivån.

classFeature.name: Soul Linked Casting
entries: Du och din följeslagare är av samma själ, och du kan kanalisera magi genom din länk.

På femte nivån kan du när du kastar en besvärjelse som riktar sig till dig själv välja att besvärjelsen även ska påverka din följeslagare om denne befinner sig inom 60 fot från dig. Om du tappar koncentrationen på besvärjelsen förlorar ni båda effekten, och du måste göra koncentrationskontroller även om din följeslagare tar skada, som om du tog den mängden skada.

classFeature.name: Soul Infused Attacks
entries: Från och med 6:e nivån räknas dina kamraters attacker som magiska när det gäller att övervinna motstånd och immunitet mot icke-magiska attacker och skador.

classFeature.name: Companion's Protection
entries: När du når 6:e nivån är din följeslagares försvar bättre än någonsin och han eller hon kan undvika allt från fällor till trollformler. Den får färdighet i alla räddningskast.
Dessutom har den en fördel på räddningsförsök med intelligens och karisma när du befinner dig inom 30 meter från den och den kan se dig.

classFeature.name: Soul Bond Feature
entries: På 7:e nivån får du en egenskap från ditt Soul Bond.

classFeature.name: Project Senses
entries: Från och med 7:e nivån kan du projicera ditt sinne in i din följeslagare. Som en handling kan du se genom din följeslagares ögon och höra vad den hör fram till början av din nästa vändning, och du får fördelarna av alla speciella sinnen som följeslagaren har. Under denna tid är du döv och blind när det gäller dina egna sinnen. Medan du ser med din följeslagares ögon kan du också välja att tala genom den med din egen röst projicerad från dess mun.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: När du når 8:e nivån kan du öka en valfri förmågepoäng med 2 eller två valfria förmågepoäng med 1. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågepoäng över 20 med den här funktionen.
Om din DM tillåter användning av feats kan du istället ta en {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Resting Voice
entries: Från och med 9:e nivån kan du nu återfå alla dina edicts på en kort eller lång vila.

classFeature.name: Countermeasure
entries: På 10:e nivån är din följeslagare mycket beskyddande mot dig och kommer att skada alla som försöker skada dig. När du blir måltavla för en attack kan din följeslagare ta en av följande reaktioner:

entries.name: Revenge.
entries: Kompanjonen kan använda sin reaktion för att göra en attack mot fienden om den är inom räckhåll.

entries.name: Roar.
entries: Den använder sin reaktion för att låta ett skräckinjagande vrål ljuda för att ge nackdel på angreppskastet så länge angriparen befinner sig inom 30 fot från den och inte är döv.

entries.name: Body Shield.
entries: Om din följeslagare befinner sig inom 1,5 meter från dig när attacken utförs kan den använda sin reaktion för att omdirigera attacken till att rikta den mot följeslagaren istället.

classFeature.name: Soul Bond Feature
entries: På 11:e nivån får du en egenskap från ditt Soul Bond.

classFeature.name: Advanced Offense (both options)
entries: På 11:e nivån får du den andra funktionen av Advanced Offense som du inte valde på 5:e nivån.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: När du når 12:e nivån kan du öka en valfri förmågepoäng med 2 eller två valfria förmågepoäng med 1. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågepoäng över 20 med den här funktionen.
Om din DM tillåter användning av feats kan du istället ta en {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Soul Purification
entries: När du når 14:e nivån kan du använda din själsenergi för att spola ut alla negativa effekter som för närvarande hindrar din följeslagare.

Om din följeslagare påverkas av en magisk effekt som gör det möjligt för den att göra ett räddningskast i början eller slutet av sina vändor, eller som en handling, kan du använda din handling för att låta din följeslagare omedelbart försöka göra räddningskastet, även om den redan har gjort det under nämnda vändning.

classFeature.name: Soul Bond Feature
entries: På 15:e nivån får du en egenskap från ditt Soul Bond.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: När du når 16:e nivån kan du öka en valfri förmågaspoäng med 2 eller två valfria förmågor med 1. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågaspoäng över 20 med den här funktionen.
Om din DM tillåter användning av feats kan du istället ta en {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Resonating Voice
entries: På 18:e nivån använder du din magi för att beordra din följeslagare med en röst som ger resonans med ert gemensamma själsband.
När du använder ett edikt kan du välja ett annat edikt som du känner till och få det att påverka din följeslagare också.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: När du når 19:e nivån kan du öka en valfri förmågaspoäng med 2 eller två valfria förmågor med 1. Som vanligt kan du inte öka en förmågaspoäng över 20 med den här funktionen.
Om din DM tillåter användning av feats kan du istället ta en {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Soul Infused Giant
entries: När du når 20:e nivån kan du ge din följeslagare all din energi för att göra den till en gigant av råstyrka.
Som en åtgärd medan din följeslagare befinner sig inom 120 fot kan du välja att förvandla den, medan den förvandlas får den följande fördelar:

items: It increases its size by two category–from Medium to Huge, for example.
Its attacks deals an extra {@dice 2d10}.
It deals double damage to structures.
Its current and maximum hit points are increased by 50.
Its movement speed is doubled

entries: The transformation ends after 1 hour has passed, the companion goes {@condition unconscious} or you end it as an action. Once you have used this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Wild
entries: You are in touch with nature itself and have offered something of yourself to it. In return, you are given a trusty animal companion that protects you and carries out your orders. Your bond with the beast makes you inseparable.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Companion
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the company of a loyal beast. It has the appearance of your choice, uses the {@creature Beast Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block and gains one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The beast has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Sneaky.
entries: The beast has expertise in Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Nocturnal.
entries: The beast gains {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious.
entries: The beast can breathe air and water. It also gains a swimming speed equal to its walking speed.

entries.name: Leaper.
entries: The beast's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Spider Climb.
entries: The beast can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Big Boned.
entries: The beast's size is Large.
You may pick one additional trait at 7th and 11th level.
You also get to allocate the following stats for your beast: 16, 14 and 12. You can place them in the beast's Strength, Dexterity and Constitution scores.
You can communicate basic ideas to your beast with a few hand signs and nods.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Wild
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and medium armor. Additionally your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Run With the Pack
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you and your beast know each other's every move and you perform best in combat when you are together. When you and your beast are within 10 feet of each other and neither of you are {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following benefits:

items: When your beast hits a creature with an attack, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against the same creature.
If one of you is {@condition prone}, it only takes 5 feet of movement to stand up again.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Evolution
entries: At 7th level, your beast is infused with magic via your bond and can evolve itself in different ways. You can pick one of the following features to grant to your beast:

items.name: Fast Flier.
items.entry: Your beast gains a flying speed equal to double its walking speed. It also gains Flyby, meaning it doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Charger.
items.entry: Your beast gains an extra 15 feet walking speed. Additionally, if the beast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an attack on the same turn, the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d10} damage to the target. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Relentless Rampager.
items.entry: When the beast is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can drop to 1 hit point instead. It can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. Additionally when the beast reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, the beast can use its reaction to move up to half of its speed and make one attack. If it hits with that attack, it gains half of the damage dealt as temporary hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Commands
entries: At 11th level, you can command your beast with the guidance of nature itself. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Tooth and Nail.
items.entry: Your beast can use its action to make a melee attack against each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it, with a separate attack roll for each target.

items.name: Dodge and Evade.
items.entry: Until the end of your next turn, whenever your beast is hit by an attack that it can see, it can use its reaction to reduce the incoming attack's damage by half.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Evolution
entries: When you reach 15th level, your beast has surpassed any limits you could imagine. Your essence is infused within its body, pushing it to the peak of its evolution.
It gains two additional traits from your Beast Companion feature and one additional option from your Bestial Evolution feature.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Unknown
entries: By conducting an otherworldly ritual, you have summoned an aberration and bound it to your command. Whether you had captured it through hard work and research, or had to make a great sacrifice in order to have this unnatural being unde ryour command, you two are bound and use your newly gained bizarre powers to your own benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Aberrant
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you gain the servitude of an aberration. It has the appearance of your choice, uses the {@creature Aberration Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block and you can communicate with it telepathically as long as you are within 100 feet of each other.
Additionally, when you bind yourself to the aberration you learn to speak, read and write Deep Speech.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As your soul is bound to a magical being, you gain access to more spells than usual. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Morph
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you can use an action to touch your aberration and become absorbed, morphing together as a single unit for 1 minute. While you are morphed with your aberration, it gains the following benefits:

items: Its Claws attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage. This damage becomes {@dice 2d6} at 15th level.
The reach of its Tentacles attack becomes 20 feet.
It gains temporary hit points equal to half your soul binder's current hit points, but will lose them when the morph ends.
It increases its size by one category–from Medium to Large, for example.

entries: While you are morphed with your aberration, you can't take actions or reactions except ending the morph as a bonus action, and cannot move unless specified. While morphed you can still command your companion and use your Edict feature telepathically.
If you are concentrating on a spell while morphed, you must make a concentration check when the aberration is hit, using the aberration's Constitution for the roll.

The morph ends after 1 minute, when the aberration is {@condition incapacitated}, or if you choose to end it. When morph ends, the soul binder emerges from the aberration in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.

You may use this feature without any negative effects once per long rest. The morphing process is hard for the soul binder's body, making it hard to sustain the use of it. Everytime you end this feature after the first, you gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Grasp
entries: When you reach 7th level, your aberration has learned to pull creatures closer using either tentacles or telekinesis and show them images that can drive them mad.

As an action your aberration can target up to 6 creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it. Target creatures must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the aberration.

Your companion can immediately spend its bonus action to attempt to {@action grapple} one of the pulled creatures. If a creature is {@condition grappled} in this way, it is {@condition frightened} of you and your aberration until the grapple ends.
Once your aberration uses this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Edicts
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can command your aberration to use its newly gained unnatural abilities. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Toxic Spit.
items.entry: Your companion spits a glob of toxin at an enemy within 30 feet of it as a bonus action. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the next minute. The enemy can repeat the save at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Horrifying Form.
items.entry: You command your aberration to twist its form and instill fear in your foes. The next time it hits a creature with an attack on this turn, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of them until the end of your companion's next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Morph
entries: When you reach 15th level, your body has become more accepting of your aberration, and you are much more potent at morphing together. While morphed with your companion it gains the following additional benefits:

items: While you are morphed you can see through your aberration's senses.
You can now take the {@action Cast a Spell} action while morphed. When you do so, you cast the spell though your aberration and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell.
You can choose to increase your aberration's size to Huge for the duration of Morph.

entries: Additionally, you can now stay morphed for longer and your body has an easier time being in this conjoined state. You can retain your morph for 1 hour and you may use this feature once per short rest without any negative effects

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Dragonkin
entries: You have bound your soul to a drake in hopes of protection and power. Maybe you have been chosen by a dragon to receive an everlasting gift as it created a Guard Drake especially for you, binding your souls together as one to protect one another. Or you gained the trust of such a beast in a deadly situation, bonding for life to mutually help eachother.

entries.subclassFeature: Tongue and Scales of the Drake|Soul Binder|SoulBinderFragSauce|Dragonkin|SoulBinderFragSauce|1

subclassFeature.name: Guardian of the Dragon
entries: At 1st level, you were given a chromatic guard drake and bonded with it. The drake has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Drake Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block. Your companion gains certain features depending on its color. When you gain this feature choose one of the following:

entries.name: Black Guard Drake.
entries: A black guard drake is amphibious (it can breathe air or water), has a swimming speed of 30 feeta nd has resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Blue Guard Drake.
entries: A blue guard drake has a burrowing speed of 20 feet and resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Green Guard Drake.
entries: A green guard drake is amphibious (it can breathe air or water), has a swimming speed of 30 feet and has resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Red Guard Drake.
entries: A red guard drake has climbing speed of 30 feet and resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: White Guard Drake.
entries: A white guard drake has a burrowing speed of 20 feet, a climbing speed of 30 feet and resistance to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tongue and Scales of the Drake
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you learn to speak Draconic in order to talk to your drake.
Additionally you gain proficiency with martial weapons and medium armor. Your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Challenge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your drake is a force to be reckoned with, drawing attention from teammates on the battlefield. When your dragon hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can mark the creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if your dragon is {@condition incapacitated} or it dies, or if someone else marks the creature.
While the marked creature is within 5 feet of your dragon, the creature marked by your dragon has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target your dragon.

In addition, if a creature marked by your dragon deals damage to anyone other than your dragon, you can make a weapon attack against the marked creature as your reaction, if it is within range of your weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Infused Breath
entries: When you reach 7th level your drake can activate some of its draconic powers using your magic as fuel.
As an action you can spend a 1st level spell slot. If you do your dragon can use its action this turn to exhale a destructive breath.

Each creature caught in the breath must make a saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} damage on a failed save, and half on a success. When a creature fails the saving throw the drake can choose to put its Draconic mark on them, it can mark multiple creatures at once using this feature. The Shape, Damage type and saving throw is determined by the color of your drake:

You can use higher level spell slots to increase the damage. The damage increase by {@dice 2d6} for each spell slot level above 1st. {@dice 5d6} for 2nd level spell slot, {@dice 7d6} for 3rd level spell slot, {@dice 9d6} for 4th level spell slot and {@dice 11d6} for 5th level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Edict of the Dragonkin
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you can command your guard drake with the fury of a dragon. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Harden Scales.
items.entry: Until your next turn, your drake has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage and it has immunity to the damage type it has resistance to from your Guardian of the Dragon feature.

items.name: Draconic Leap.
items.entry: You point your finger at a creature or point you can see. If your drake is within 30 feet of that creature or point, it can use its bonus action to leap to it. If its a creature it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Blessing
entries: When you reach 15th level, you have studied the draconic powers that lie deep within the blood of your companion. You can transform your drake into its true dragon form for a little while.
As an action, you can cause your drake to grow wings and transform into a dragon for 1 minute. While transformed it gains the following benefits:

items: It has a flying speed of 60 feet.
It increases its size by one category–from Medium to Large, for example
Its damage dice increase to {@dice 2d8} instead of {@dice 1d8}.
It gains an amount of temporary hit points equal to your Soul Binder level, these temporary hit points dissapear when the transformation ends.
It has 10 feet reach on all of its attacks.

As a bonus action, it can let out a terrifying roar. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of the drake and aware of it, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

entries: The transformation ends after 1 minute, or if the drake uses its bonus action to end it. The drake can only transform again after it finishes a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Elements
entries: You are in balance with the world, and the elements that surround you. You are so closely bonded with them that you can manifest an elemental avatar, using part of your soul to anchor it to this plane of existence.

subclassFeature.name: Aid of the Elements
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, the elements themselves have granted you the aid of an elemental avatar, that takes on a different shape depending on which element you are attuned to. The avatar has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Elemental Avatar|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

When you gain this feature you may pick one of the following elemental types to attune to: fire, cold, lightning or thunder. On your turn you can change the attuned elemental type of your avatar as an action.
Each element will also give your avatar a set of unique traits and a cantrip that it can cast. The different elements are detailed in the Elements table below.

entries.caption: Elements
rows: The avatar has a flying (hover) speed equal to its walking speed.
The avatar can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.
The avatar sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30-feet radius.
The avatar has a swimming speed equal to its walking speed, and has the Amphibious trait.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As your soul becomes one with the elements and nature itself, you gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Burst
entries: At 3rd level, your avatar has learned to harness its elemental powers with great fury. As an action, it can burst elemental force all around it.

Every creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must make a saving throw which is dependent on the element of the attack, taking {@dice 3d8} damage of your current attuned elemental type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Additionally, they suffer one of the following effects, dependent on what element you are attuned to:

entries.name: Air
entries: Any creature within the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the avatar.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Any creature within the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Any creature within the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or get charred, imposing disadvantage on their next attack.

entries.name: Water
entries: Any creature within the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 feet, until the end of your next turn.
Once your avatar has used this feature it must finish a long rest before it can do so again.

The damage of this feature increases by 1d8 as you gain levels in this class. The damage improves to {@dice 4d8} at 7th level, {@dice 5d8} at 11th level, {@dice 6d8} at 15th level and {@dice 7d8} at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Boon of Nature
entries: When you reach 7th level, your soul is infused with the essence of nature through your avatar. As an action, you can use this power to empower your avatar. It keeps this boon for 1 minute. The boon has a different effect depending on what element you are attuned to, and the boon will not change even if you attune to a different element while it is in effect.

entries.name: Air
entries: Your avatar runs swift like lightning. Its speed becomes 90 feet, and opportunity attacks against it have disadvantage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Your avatar hardens its rocky carapace. It gains temporary hit points equal to double your Charisma modifier at the start of its turns.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Your avatar strikes with precision. It can add your Charisma modifier to its attack rolls.

entries.name: Water
entries: Your avatar freezes enemies into place. It can attempt to {@action grapple} a creature within 5 feet of it as a bonus action. While {@condition grappled} by this feature, the {@condition grappled} creature is also {@condition restrained}. The avatar can only have one creature {@condition grappled} like this at a time.
Once you have used this feature you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Edicts of the Elements
entries: At the 11th level, you can command your avatar to unleash their elemental powers. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Elemental Bolt.
items.entry: You command your avatar to hurl a bolt of elemental energy. It must use its reaction to send a bolt flying in a direction of your choice, flying in a 30-feet long and 5-feet wide line. When it hits a creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d8} damage of your current attuned type and the bolt disperses. If creature does succeed, the bolt keeps flying until it hits another creature or travels its full distance.

items.name: Punch of the Avatar.
items.entry: Your avatar gathers elemental energy in its hand, unleashing its energy when next striking a foe. If a creature is hit by your elemental's attack until the end of this turn, it takes an additional {@dice 3d8} damage of your current attuned type and must succeed on a saving throw determined by your attuned element. On a failed save it is subjected to a negative effect. The saving throw and its effect is identical to the one in your Elemental Burst feature.

subclassFeature.name: Merged Attunement
entries: When you reach 15th level, your avatar can take on a form of multiple elements, combining the strength of both. You can now attune to two elements at once. Your avatar gains resistance to both damage types associated with said elements. When your elemental attacks, it can choose between the two damage types for its attacks. It does the same for its Edict options and when it uses Elemental Burst. It gains both traits and cantrips from your attuned elements. When you use your Boon of Nature feature, it gains the effects of both elements as well.
When you use an action to change your avatar's elements, you can choose to change both at once.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Dirge
entries: You have used a piece of your soul to revive a dead corpse, and returned them to this world under your command. Now they walk with you and serve you as their master, aiding you by utilizing their undead nature.

subclassFeature.name: Servant from the Afterlife
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you gain a zombie as your companion. It has the appearance of a zombified humanoid of your choice and uses the {@creature Zombie Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As you tap into the necromantic powers of the dead, you gain access to more spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Collecting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your zombie has an aura of necrotic energy that consumes some energy from a soul as it is leaving a body.
Whenever a creature within 10 feet of the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points, the zombie gains temporary hit points equal to half your soul binder level.

subclassFeature.name: Deathly Control
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your zombie can manipulate bodies like a twisted pupped as their life is leaving them.

Whenever a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within 10 feet of the zombie, the zombie can use its reaction to make that creature make one melee weapon attack against a creature of the zombie's choice within range.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Edicts
entries: At the 11th level, you can command your zombie with a voice from beyond the grave. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Infectious Claws.
items.entry: The next time your zombie hits a creature with its attack this turn, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Mass Collection.
items.entry: Until the end of your next turn the range of your zombie's Soul Collection and Deathly Control is increased to 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Feasting Growth
entries: When you reach 15th level, your zombie has feasted upon so much flesh and soul, that it grows into an undead monster. Whenever your zombie eats a piece of a fresh soul by using Soul Collecting, it can enter an enlarged and enraged state. While the zombie is in this form, it gains several benefits:

items: Its size becomes Large.
It has a speed of 40 feet, as well as 40 feet climbing speed.
It has advantage on its saving throw for Undead Fortitude.
Its attacks deals an extra {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage.

entries: It stays in this form for 1 minute, or if it ends it as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Divine
entries: Sometimes gods grant gifts to worthy mortals. They can take all shapes and forms and you have been given a boon in the form of a friend and protector for life.
Soul binders that make a bond with a celestial are often followers of the god that the celestial used to serve, traveling the world and spreading the word of that god.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian of the Heavens
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you bind your soul with a celestial creature. The celestial has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Holy Guardian|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Warrior
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency with medium armor and martial weapons. You can also speak, read and write Celestial. Additionally your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of Life
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your companion has learned to be selfless and giving, sacrificing part of its life energy to heal you or your companions.

Your guardian can use a bonus action to deal damage to itself, in turn healing a creature of its choice within 5 feet of it. This damage ignores temporary hit points, immunities and resistances. The creature regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Heal
entries: At 7th level, you know how to mend wounds and inspire your guardian to perform better in combat.
You learn the {@spell healing word} spell. You always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. It counts as a soul binder spell for you.
Additionally, whenever you cast {@spell healing word} on your guardian, it can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Edicts of Radiance
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can command your guardian with a voice that can pierce the heavens. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Blinding Light.
items.entry: You command your guardian to unleash its inner radiant light. On its turn it can use its action to release its blinding energy. Creatures of its choice within 15 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spread Your Wings.
items.entry: Your words inspire your guardian to fly as high as the sky. It has a flying speed of 60 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Death Prevention
entries: When you reach 15th level, your guardian have gained the powers to protect people from the grasp of death.

If a creature within 60 feet of your companion drops to 0 hit points or fails a death saving throw, your guardian can use its reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature and breathe new life into them. The creature regains {@dice 10d12} hit points.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Playful Fey
entries: There are places where the barrier between the Material Plane and the Feywild is thin, and sometimes creatures from one plane end up in another. Soul binders have found that creatures from the Fey make excellent companions. Maybe you got your companion as a gift from an Archfey or maybe the two of you became friends naturally and made a bond.

subclassFeature.name: Trickster Spirit
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you make a bond with a playful creature from the Feywild. The fey has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Fey Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block. Additionally, as your soul is bonded with the creature, you learn to speak its language. You can speak, read and write Sylvan.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As you bind with this magical creature from another plane, you are able to have more spells available to you. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Trickster's Dance
entries: At 3rd level, your companion has learned to use their illusory powers to confuse and play tricks on their enemies.
Whenever your companion is hit with a melee weapon attack, it can use its reaction to reduce the damage of the attack by {@dice 1d8} + your Charisma modifier + your soul binder level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, your companion can force the enemy to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes psychic damage equal to the original amount of damage their attack would have dealt.
Your fey can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). It regains all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Evasiveness
entries: When you reach 7th level, you have learned to channel the powers from the Feywild and can use that energy to form a protective veil over your companion.

Whenever your companion is forced to make a saving throw due to a spell or another magical effect, you can use your reaction to give your companion advantage on the saving throw if you are within 30 feet of it.

subclassFeature.name: Jester's Edicts
entries: At 11th level, you can command your companion to pull playful maneuvers. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Hide and Seek.
items.entry: You command your companion to hide itself from preying eyes. On its next turn it can use a bonus action to turn {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn. The invisibility is broken if the companion makes an attack or otherwise harms another creature.

items.name: Hop and Skip.
items.entry: You command your companion to blink in and out of the Fey, jumping to a different position. On its turn, your companion can use its bonus action to teleport up to 30 feet to a point that it can see.

subclassFeature.name: Fooling Copycat
entries: When you reach 15th level, your companion resonates with you so well, that it can mimic your every move.

As a bonus action, your companion can create an illusion over itself that is identical you, including the clothes and equipment you are currently wearing. The illusion lasts for 10 minutes or until the companion ends it as a bonus action. While the illusion is active, the companion gains the following benefits:

items: On its turn it can cast {@spell Soul Switch|SoulBinderFragSauce} without expending a spell slot or material components.
While the two of you are within 5 feet of each other, you both have advantage on attack rolls, and creatures short of {@sense truesight} have disadvantage on attacks against the two of you.
The companion can speak any of your languages using your voice.
You and your companion can communicate telepathically as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Demonic Pain
entries: Some say the most dangerous of the Lower Planes, the Abyss holds endless hoards of animalistic monstrosities with only one goal: rend, tear, and destroy. You have made a spiritual bond with such a wretched creature, which could be of mutual benefit, or one-sided. Perhaps you enslaved this creature in an act of good faith to protect others from its wrath; or maybe in a desperate moment you performed a foul ritual that bonded this monster to your soul.

entries.subclassFeature: Friend from the Abyss|Soul Binder|SoulBinderFragSauce|Demonic Pain|SoulBinderFragSauce|1

subclassFeature.name: Friend from the Abyss
entries: At 1st level, you have made a bond with a demon from the depth of the Abyss. The demon has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Blood Demon|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.
As you bind your soul with this demonic being, you learn its otherworldly tongue. You can speak, read and write Abyssal.

subclassFeature.name: Whip Master
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you gain proficiency with whips. Additionally, when you use a whip it has the following special properties:

items: You can extend the reach of the whip with demonic fury. The whip gains an additional 5 feet reach, to a total of 15 feet.
The whip is even deadlier in your hands and brings more pain. The whip's damage die increases to {@dice 1d6}. This damage increases to {@dice 1d8} when you reach 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Conduit of Agony
entries: Beginning at 3rd level you know how to inflict pain on your demon and make that pain resonate with nearby foes.

As an action you can make a special kind of melee weapon attack targeting your demon, you don't make an attack roll as this special attack always hits. When your demon takes damage from this attack it will send out a pulse of pain, and every creature of your choice within 5 feet of your demon must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take the same amount of damage as your demon took from the attack as psychic damage. Additionally when you use this feature, your demon will have advantage on its next attack rolls this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Veins
entries: When you reach 7th level, your demon fights best when it is covered in blood. Whenever your demon is below half of its maximum hit points, it gains the following benefits:

items: It gains double the amount of temporary hit points from the its Demonic Toughness feature.
When you use Conduit of Agony, the enemies take twice the damage your demon took, if they fail the saving throw.
It can choose to make its melee attacks deal fire damage instead of its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Painful Edicts
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can command your demon to inflict pain to both its enemies and itself. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Painful Retaliation.
items.entry: You command your demon to consume the damage that foes inflict on it. Until the end of your next turn, whenever your demon takes damage, it can use its reaction to deal an amount of damage back to its attacker equal to the damage it just took as psychic damage.

items.name: No Regards.
items.entry: Your command makes your demon lose all care for its own health and go berserk. Until the start of your next turn, your demon deals double damage with all melee attacks, but it also becomes vulnerable to all incoming damage.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Torment
entries: When you reach 15th level, your demon becomes an avatar of agony, sharing its misery with other creatures. As an action, your demon can try to make a blood bond with a creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be bound by blood to the demon for 1 minute or until one of them drops to 0 hit points. Whenever the demon takes damage, the target takes half of that damage. The affected target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The demon can only create a blood bond with one creature at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Stitcher
entries: While some soul binders turn to nature or living creatures, others use science and magic to create life on their own, and infuse their own soul into their creations to keep them alive and stable. They will often bolt, pin or stitch new parts to their creation to improve it in all walks of life.

subclassFeature.name: Your Creation
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you have managed to create your own creature from different parts and infused it with your soul. The creation has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Monsterous Creation|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block. As a base for your creation, you must also pick one of the following options to serve as a chassis:

entries.name: Muscly.
entries: Your creation gains +2 to its Strength score, and its size becomes Large.

entries.name: Feline.
entries: Your creation gains +2 to its Strength score, and its size becomes Large.

entries.name: Chitinous.
entries: Your creation gains +2 to its Constitution score, and +1 to its AC.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As you bind and use your magic on your creation you begin to grasp the relation between the arcane and malleable matter, gaining access to additional spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Modified Appendages
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you have managed to switch out the arms of your creation to something more interesting. Choose one of the following options to give to your creation:

items.name: Tentacles.
items.entry: The creature's Limbs attack now has a reach of 10 feet. Additionally, whenever your creation hits a creature with a Limbs attack, it can attempt to {@action grapple} that creature as a bonus action.

items.name: Extra Arms.
items.entry: Whenever your creation takes the {@action Attack} action, it can choose to forgo adding its proficiency bonus to all attacks. If it does so, it can make one additional attack as part of that action.

items.name: Blunt Fists.
items.entry: When the creation hits a creature with its Limbs attack, it can use its bonus action to attempt to {@action shove} the creature. Additionally, your monster deals an additional {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage with its Limbs when attacking {@condition prone} creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Modified Head
entries: At 7th level, you have experimented with changes to your creation's head, and have finally managed to implement them. Choose one of the following options to give to your creation:

items.name: Poisonous Teeth.
items.entry: When the creation hits a creature with a Bite attack, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a target succeeds on the save they are immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Big Mouth.
items.entry: When your creation hits a target, that is smaller than the creation and it is grappling, with a Bite attack, the target is swallowed, and the {@action grapple} ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the creation, and it takes {@dice 2d4} acid damage at the start of each of the creation's turns. The creation can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the creation dies or goes {@condition unconscious}, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}. The swallowed creature can use its action to make a Strength saving throw, escaping on a success.

items.name: Lightning Breath.
items.entry: As an action, your creation can exhale a line of lightning that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the creation has used its lightning breath, it must finish a short or long rest to regain its use.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Edicts
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you have taught your creation commands that will help it in combat. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Stomp.
items.entry: Your creation can use its action to stomp the ground. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}, taking {@dice 6d8} bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Elemental Skin.
items.entry: You command your companion to magically coat itself in elemental energy. until the start of your next turn, any creature that hits your creation with a melee attack takes {@dice 2d6} fire, lightning, poison or cold damage (you choose when you use the edict.)

subclassFeature.name: Final Modification
entries: When you reach 15th level, you have been working a long time on your creation and thinking of ways to improve it, and now you are finally ready to make your final and most powerful modification. Choose one of the following options to give to your creation:

items.name: Strong Legs.
items.entry: If the creation jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement, it can use a bonus action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save a creature is knocked {@condition prone}, taking {@dice 3d10} bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, but is pushed 5 feet out of the creation's space into an unoccupied space of the target's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the creation's space.

items.name: Big Wings.
items.entry: Your creation gains a flying speed equal to twice its walking speed. Additionally, it can use its action to make a Wing attack. When it does so, any creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must make a Strength saving throw, taking {@dice 6d8} bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful save a creature takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Displacement.
items.entry: Your creation projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while your creation is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Ooze
entries: You infused a piece of your soul into a puddle of ooze to empower it so that it can help you in your goals. Maybe you animated a pile of liquid by accident through an alchemical or arcane experiment or you deliberately sought out a spawn of Jubilex himself to gain mutual power.

subclassFeature.name: Liquid Friend
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you have bound yourself to an ooze and gained it as your companion. The ooze has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Ooze Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: As you tap into the magical powers of oozes and gain a better understanding of their nature, you are able to have more spells available to you. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Split
entries: Your ooze will sometimes fall apart, but you have taught it how to pick itself back together.

Starting at 3rd level, whenever your ooze takes damage from an attack that is greater or equal to twice your proficiency bonus it can use its reaction to shoot off a little piece of itself that lands in an a space of its choice that is 10 feet away. When your ooze comes in contact with a piece, it consumes the piece, regaining {@dice 1d4} hit points. If not consumed within 1 minute, the piece disappears.
This healing becomes stronger as you gain levels in this class: {@dice 1d6} at 5th level, {@dice 1d8} at 9th level, {@dice 1d10} at 13th level and {@dice 1d12} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Engulf
entries: When you reach 7th level, you have taught your ooze to engulf and consume creatures.

As an action the Ooze can try and engulf a creature smaller than the ooze within 5 feet of it. The creature must make Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + its Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the ooze's side rather than be engulfed. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the ooze enters the creature's space, and the creature takes {@dice 2d8} acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes {@dice 2d8} acid damage at the start of each of your turns. When the ooze moves, the engulfed creature moves with you. An engulfed creature can try to escape by making an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check as per escaping a {@action grapple}. On a success, the engulfed creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze. An engulfed creature automatically escapes the ooze if the ooze falls {@condition unconscious}.

The ooze can only have one creature engulfed at a time. Creatures inside it can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of the ooze can attempt to pull an engulfed creature. Doing so requires a successful opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

subclassFeature.name: Fluid Edicts
entries: At 11th level you can give out edicts to your ooze with fluidity and perfection. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Sticky Form.
items.entry: Your ooze can use a bonus action to make a attempt a {@action grapple} against every creature within 5 feet of it on its turn.

items.name: Acidic Form.
items.entry: Until the start of your next turn, when your ooze is hit with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@dice 3d6} acid damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improving Form
entries: Beginning at 15th level, your ooze has learned from its mistakes and now it grows stronger ever time it collects itself.
Whenever your ooze hits a creature with its Pseudopod attack, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage of the attack's type for every piece of itself it has collected on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Verdant
entries: A gift from mother nature, an alchemical experiment or a druidic ritual are all things that may cause you to make both a magical and a sympathetic bond with a plant, infusing it with your own soul to give it strength and purpose.

subclassFeature.name: Friendly Flora
entries: When you choose this bond at 1st level, you have bound yourself with a magical plant and gained it as your trusty  companion. The plant has the appearance of your choice and uses the {@creature Plant Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: When you choose this bond, you become magically attuned to nature, expanding your knowledge in druidic magics. You gain access to additional spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Entangling Arms
entries: At 3rd level, your plant has grown strong roots and vines that can seize the momentum of creatures.

As an action, your plant can attempt to entangle a creature within 10 feet of the plant. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice). On a failed save, the target is {@condition grappled} by your companion. While grappled in this way, a creature is {@condition restrained}. The target can use its action to repeat the saving throw ending both the {@action grapple} and {@condition restrained} conditions on a success. Your plant can only have one creature {@condition grappled} by the use of this feature, and while it has someone {@condition grappled} this way, it can only attack that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Rootcaller
entries: When you reach 7th level, your plant can use its magic to reach into the earth and call the roots forth to trap its enemies.
Your plant can cast {@spell entangle} and {@spell ensnaring strike} using your Soul Binder Spell Save DC.
The plant can cast the spells a combined number of two times. It regains all uses when it finishes a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Edicts of Flora
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you control your plant with extreme precision. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Toss.
items.entry: You command your companion to throw a creature it has entangled. On its turn, your plant can use its bonus action to force an enemy it has {@condition grappled} to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is is flung 30 feet away from the plant in a direction of the plant's choice.

items.name: Extending Vines.
items.entry: By your command, your plant attempts to pull enemies into danger. If your plant uses its Entangling Arms feature on its turn, it can target a creature within 30 feet of it. If the target fails to escape the {@action grapple}, it also gets pulled within 10 feet of the plant.

subclassFeature.name: Lifeline
entries: At 15th level, your plant can redirect some of the damage it is taking towards a held target.

Whenever your plant takes damage while it is grappling a target with its Entangling Arms feature, the damage is reduced by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier and the {@condition grappled} creature takes damage equal to your Charisma modifier that is of the same type as the damage your plant took.
Additionally, your plant can now use its Entangling Arms feature as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Split Soul
entries: Some Soul Binders don't bind their soul to another creature, but instead split their own soul into two pieces and creates a body for their split soul, one with martial skills and the original is a caster.

subclassFeature.name: Twin Companion
entries: At 1st level you have split yourself in two and now has a twin companion, it is the same race as you and use the {@creature Twin Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block. Your twin companion start with: a longsword, a chain shirt and a shield as its equipment.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: When you choose this bond, your arcane knowledge is expanded. You gain access to additional spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Specialized Twin
entries: At 3rd level your twin has trained in combat and is beginning to develop its own style, choose one of the following features below:

entries.name: Striker.
entries: When you use the Strike Edict, your twin will have advantage on its next attack this round.

entries.name: Commander.
entries: When you use the Toughen Up Edict, your twin can give an ally within 5 feet of it temporary hit points equal half the amount it gained from the edict.

entries.name: Skirmisher.
entries: When you use the Move edict, the twin can take both the {@action disengage} and {@action dash} action as part of the same bonus action.

entries.name: Guardian.
entries: When you use the Block Edict all allies within 5 feet of the twin also gets the additional AC for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Determination
entries: When you reach 7th level your twin has gained an undying determination to stay in battle and fight for you and itself.

When your twin's HP is reduced to 0 and it is not killed outright, it can move up to half its speed and make one melee attack as a reaction, before falling {@condition unconscious}. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and if the attack hits, the twin regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.
Once it has used this feature it must finish a long rest before it can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Edicts of Self
entries: Beginning at 11th level you know how to guide your twin in combat to help them survive. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

entries.name: Helping Hand.
entries: This turn your twin can take the {@action Use an Object} or the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Quick Attacks.
entries: When you use the Block Edict all allies within 5 feet of the twin also gets the additional AC for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Specialization of Mastery
entries: At 15th level your twin has mastered whatever style it choose earlier.
Depending on which style you chose at 3rd level your twin get one of the following features:

entries.name: Striker.
entries: Once per turn if your twin hits a creature that is within 5 feet of one of its allies, it can add its proficiency modifier to the damage roll.

entries.name: Commander.
entries: Your twin can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Skirmisher.
entries: Whenever your twin gets a critical hit with a weapon attack or reduce a creature to 0 hit points on its turn, it can immediately move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Guardian.
entries: Your twin can use its Countermeasure feature on all allies instead of only on you.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Puppet
entries: Some people don't feel comfortable binding with live creatures, so they bind their soul to a carefully crafted puppet, giving it great power and allowing full control through the tether between the split soul.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Puppet
entries: At 1st level you have bonded your soul to a carefully crafted puppet that can house a piece of it. The puppet can look however you want but uses the {@creature Puppet Companion|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: When you choose this bond, your soul becomes in tune with your magical puppet. You gain access to additional spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Take Control
entries: At 3rd level you have studied your puppet and feel a stronger connection to it, you can now take total control of the puppet so it fights with the might of two.
As an action you can take full control if you can see your puppet and if it is within 60 feet and you can see it, until the start of your next turn the you and puppet gain the following benefits:

items: Your puppet has an extra +2 to its AC.
Your puppet has an additional 15 feet walking speed.
Your puppets attacks has a {@dice 1d12} as its damage dice instead of a 1d8.
The range of your puppets Strings Attached trait extends to a range of 60 feet.
You become {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn, the invisibility also ends if you move, make an {@action attack} or {@action cast a spell}.

subclassFeature.name: Recover
entries: When you reach 7th level you know how to pull your puppet out of a tight spot.
Whenever your puppet takes damage and is within 60 feet, you can use your reaction to pull the puppet to a spot within 5 feet of you, your puppet then regain {@dice 3d10} hit points.
Once you have used this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Edicts of the Puppeteer
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you become a puppet master. The following commands are added to your Edict options:

items.name: Intertwine.
items.entry: As a bonus action on this turn your puppet can choose a creature that is standing between the Soul Binder and the puppet, that creature must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Quick Control.
items.entry: Your puppet gets the benefits as if you used your action to activate the Take Control feature.

subclassFeature.name: Absolute Control
entries: At 15th level you can take even finer control of your control of your puppet.
When your puppet is under the effect of the Take Control feature it can now make three attacks when it takes the {@action Attack} action on its turn, and it has advantage on all saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Soul Troll
entries: Troll regenerate and every time they do they absorb some of what killed them, you have found a troll an killed it over and over again with soul magic until the troll has absorbed so much of your soul that the two of you are bonded and the troll is under your control.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Giant
entries: At 1st level you have bonded your soul to a grotesque troll that smells like swamp water, the troll can look however you want but uses the {@creature Soul Troll|SoulBinderFragSauce} stat block.
As you bind your soul with this giant creature, you learn its ancient tongue. You can speak, read and write Giant.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: When you choose this bond, your soul becomes in tune with the giant regenerating troll. You gain access to additional spells. These spells are always prepared and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. They are soul binder spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Regeneration
entries: At 3rd level you learn how to activate your troll innate powers to regenerate itself for a period of time.

As an action you can make your troll start to regenerate itself for 1 minute, during this time at the start of its turn it regains a number of hit points equal to your Charisma modifier, the troll doesn;t regain these hit points if it has taken fire or acid damage since the end of its last turn or if the Soul Binder is {@condition unconscious}.
Once you have used this feature you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Infusion
